Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The reasoning identifies that cases likely begin with 'Register patient' and progress through activities until 'Patient discharged.' This establishes the logical sequence for grouping events.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning uses patient attributes (age, gender) and timestamps to determine logical boundaries between cases, ensuring events with overlapping timelines but different patients are separated.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: The reasoning proposes that events 1-4 belong to the first case because they relate to a single patient (age 45, male) registered in the ER and undergoing initial triage.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The reasoning validates this grouping by confirming the sequence of activities (register, triage, imaging, discharge) matches typical hospital workflows for the first patient.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The reasoning identifies another 'Register patient' event (event 2) as the likely start of a second case (age 62, female), followed by related triage and lab activities.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning deduces that events 5-7 belong to the second case, separating it from other cases by unique patient attributes and non-overlapping timestamps.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The reasoning generalizes that events 8-10 form another case based on patient attributes matching those of the second case, continuing the logical workflow.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The reasoning cross-checks that each case logically progresses through typical steps without conflicting with concurrent cases.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning infers that events 11-12 represent a consultation and discharge for the first patient, completing the sequence for that case.

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: The reasoning initially considered event 13 part of a new case but later adjusted, assigning it to the first case as surgery preparation logically followed earlier activities.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The reasoning confirms consistency in grouping events based on timestamps, patient attributes, and expected sequences of hospital processes.
